Package compiler.exceptions

package compiler.exceptions
Defines the checked Exceptions that may occur during compilation. All of them are a concrete subclass of the CompilerException. Exceptions are used (instead of simple error messages) to allow for uniform handling of errors during parsing and clearer control flow.
Author:
Alex Mandelias
  • Exception Summary
    Exception
    Description
    CompilerException
    A superclass for all of the Exceptions that may occur during compilation of a program written in the high-level language.
    InvalidConditionException
    Thrown when a high-level-program condition was read but its identifier doesn't match any of the Compiler's Conditions.
    InvalidLabelNameException
    Thrown when a symbol that does not correspond to a Label name was found in a label declaration statement.
    InvalidLineNameException
    Thrown when a symbol that does not correspond to a Line name was found when declaring a line.
    InvalidStatementException
    Thrown when a high-level-program statement was read but its identifier doesn't match any of the Compiler's Statements.
    InvalidVariableNameException
    Thrown when a symbol that does not correspond to a Variable name was found in a variable declaration statement.
    LabelAlreadyDeclaredException
    Thrown when an already-declared Label is re-declared.
    LabelNotDeclaredException
    Thrown when a Label that has not been declared is referenced.
    NoBlockException
    Thrown when a Block of a specific type was expected but not found.
    NotALabelException
    Thrown when a symbol that is expected to be a Label, is not a Label.
    NotAVariableException
    Thrown when a symbol that is expected to be a Variable, is not a Variable.
    UnclosedBlockException
    Thrown when a Block is not closed when compilation ends.
    UnexpectedTokenException
    Thrown when a Token different that the expected one was found during parsing.
    UnexpectedTokensException
    Thrown when at least one excessive Token was found during parsing.
    VariableAlreadyDeclaredException
    Thrown when an already-declared Variable is re-declared.
    VariableNotDeclaredException
    Thrown when a Variable that has not been declared is referenced.
